gold: Denying-until-death is the way a venerable person denies a matter.
gen: The Yoruba proverb "À-sẹ́-kú làgbàlagbà ńsẹ́ ọ̀ràn" translates to "An elder handles matters with what is left undone" in English. This proverb suggests that wise or experienced individuals know how to manage or resolve issues by addressing what remains unfinished or by focusing on the essentials.
